work_experience.responsibilities: Greeted and assisted patients, visitors, and staff. Managed office operations including scheduling, filing, and document preparation. Handled insurance authorizations, maintained inventory, and managed confidential records. Provided administrative support for patient information, reports, and correspondence.

Resolved operational issues and handled customer inquiries and complaints. Managed day-to-day call center operations, trained staff, and created work schedules. Maintained confidential client information and generated reports.

Maintained job files and applicant data. Managed onboarding and termination processes, processed payroll information, and maintained personnel files. Conducted new hire orientations, created employee surveys, and assisted in employee relations. Supported HR in disciplinary and unemployment review cases.

Supervised staff, trained employees, managed tax preparation operations, and maintained financial records. Monitored expenses, handled customer issues, and ensured compliance with IRS document transmission requirements.

Provided training and support on banking procedures, updated customer data, and resolved inquiries. Guided staff on financial systems, handled public inquiries, and managed project documentation and tracking.

certifications.name: Essentials of Human Resource Management Certificate Program

awards.name: Promotion to Call Center Manager
awards.description: Promoted to Call Center Manager within one year for outstanding leadership and performance.
